meanings.definition: Bound by a contract or agreement to work for a specified period of time in exchange for something, typically passage to a new country or training.
meanings.sent1: The young man was indentured to a skilled craftsman to learn the trade.
meanings.sent2: She became indentured to a wealthy family in exchange for education.
meanings.sent3: The indentured apprentice accidentally spilled paint all over the masterpiece!
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to the project was as strong as an indentured bond.
meanings.sent5: The indentured workers toiled under the scorching sun, eager for their freedom.

meanings.definition: To bind (someone) by an indenture as an apprentice or laborer.
meanings.sent1: The company indentured him for five years to work on the plantation.
meanings.sent2: They indentured the young man to learn the art of blacksmithing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous apprentice tried to indenture his friend to clean his room!
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the job was so strong, it felt like he indentured himself to it.
meanings.sent5: The idea of being indentured to a single task for life was daunting.
